newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Atlas Copco says Mazzalupi to be new MD.
newsitem.headline: Atlas Copco says Mazzalupi to be new MD.

text.p: Swedish industrial engineering group Atlas Copco announced on Monday that Giulio Mazzalupi was to be its new managing director replacing Michael Treschow who is to take the top job at appliance maker Electrolux.
Mazzalupi, who has been with the company in a variety of positions since 1971, will take over from Treschow on April 22 after Atlas Copco's annual general meeting.
Mazzalupi, born in 1940 and graaduating in mining engineering from Rome University, will be the first non-Swede in the position.
Atlas Copco said in a statement that Mazzalupi was appointed senior executive vice president and manager of the compressor technique business areas in 1991.
Treschow had been with the company for 22 years, the last six years at president and chief executive officer.
